thread.title: Man Utd news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic agent coy on summer exit | Daily Mail Online
thread.title_full: Man Utd news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic agent coy on summer exit | Daily Mail Online

author: Tom Bassam For Mailonline
title: Man Utd news: Zlatan Ibrahimovic agent coy on summer exit | Daily Mail Online
text: comments Zlatan Ibrahimovic's agent Mino Raiola has refused to rule out his client leaving Manchester United this summer after the 35-year-old has proven he could 'do it on the moon'. There were questions about whether Ibrahimovic could prove as deadly aged 35 and undertaking his first year in English football. With 26 goals and a EFL Cup winners medal - courtesy of his own man of the match performance - already he has silenced the doubters. Now there is a great clamour for the Swedish star to extend his stay at Old Trafford. The man whose job it is to manage Ibrahimovic's future, Mino Raiola, says he never doubted his client's ability to perform for United but remained non-committal on his future. Mino Raiola has refused to rule out Zlatan Ibrahimovic leaving Manchester United this summer The talismanic Swede popped up with a late header to break Southampton hearts at Wembley Raiola said he never doubted his client would succeed and that he could play 'on the moon' 'I was never in doubt [that Ibrahimovic could succeed in England],' Raiola told talkSPORT . 'If you can do it wherever he did it and knowing how he is and what kind of person and man on and off the field he is, he can do it everywhere. RELATED ARTICLES
